### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:What often happens after a long day of traveling? Choices:  A: sickness B: motion sickness C: relocation D: jet lag E: fatigue<n>Output:		motion sickness<n><n>Input: There was a time when a turtle was moving quickly. What was the turtle doing? Choices:  a turtle race b a turtle slow race c a turtle race d a turtle slow<n>Output: a turtle race<n><n>Input: One day, a clown said,” I will be here next week.” Which word is the antonym of the word “next?” Choices: a on b back c gone  <n>d last <n>Output: last<n><n><n>### Solution:<n><n>#### Solution 1<n><n>```cs<n>using System.Collections.Generic;<n>using System.Linq;<n>using System.Windows.Forms;<n>using System.Diagnostics;<n><n>namespace Problem1<n>{<n>    class Program<n>    {<n>        static int[] result = { 0 };<n>        static void Main(string[] args)<n>        {<n>            MultipleChoice multipleChoice = new MultipleChoice(result);<n>            //input<n>            multipleChoice.Input();<n>            if(result[0] == 211)<n>            {<n>                MessageBox.Show("Passed");<n>            }<n>            else<n>            {<n>                Debug.Assert(false);<n>            }<n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n><n>namespace Problem1_Multiple_Choice_Helper<n>{<n>    public class MultipleChoice<n>    {<n>        private int[] _answer;<n>        private HashSet<string> _answers;<n>        public int[] result { get; }<n><n>        public MultipleChoice(int[] result)<n>        {<n>             _answer = new int[_answer.Length];<n>             _answers = new HashSet<string>();<n>             this.result = result;<n>             FillArray();<n>        }<n><n>        private void FillArray()<n>        {<n>            _answer[0] = int.Parse(_answers.First().Split(' ')[0]);<n>        }<n>        <n>        public void Input()<n>        {<n>             int.TryParse(Console.ReadLine(), out _answer[0]);<n>             if(_answers.First(x=> x == _answer[0])!= null)<n>             {<n>                Debug.Print("Passed");<n>             }<n>             else<n>             {<n>                _answers.Add(Console.ReadLine());<n>             }

What kind of vehicle would you use to get to the moon?<n><n> <n><n>input : 7 boys have 32 books they share among themselves in the ratio of 3:2:4:5:7:3:4. then how many books do they get?<n><n>output: 15 books<n><n>https://codecube.io/codeview/8007c6ad/156679356994202508/<n><n>https://codeforces.com/contest/1278/submission/53147488<n>https://www.hackerrank.com/challenges/java-sharing-books/<n>#!/bin/python<n>import math<n>import re<n># Complete the books_sharing_among_themselves function below.<n>def books_sharing_between_themselves(num):<n>    ans=[]<n>    for i in range(1,num+1):<n>        ans=ans+1<n>    ans=str(ans)<n>    if(ans==str(num*num)):<n>        return('YES')<n>    else:<n>        return('NO')

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:What happens when you take a shower after going for a run? Choices:  A: feeling refreshed B: becoming tired C: restlessness D: leg cramps E: sweating<n>Output:		A<n><n>Input: How does the body deal with toxins? Choices: A: storing them as fat B: breathing them out C: converting them to energy D: converting them to proteins E: turning toxic acid into a base<n>Output: A<n>	<n>## Python Solution<n>### My Solution<n><n>```python<n>### Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question.<n>### Input: Janet has 114 cards more than Brenda, who has 36 cards. Mara has twice<n>### as many cards as Jan. What is the total number of cards Mara, Brenda, and Janet<n>### have?<n>### Output: 211.<n><n>def cards(m):<n>    res = 0<n>    while m > 0:<n>        res += 1<n>        m -= 1<n>    return res<n><n>solution = input()<n>a = input()<n>b = input()<n>c = input()<n>d = input()<n>e = input()<n># convert 2 digit number to integer<n>if a == 'Janet':<n>    a_length = len(a)//2<n>    a_digit = int(a[a_length+1:])<n>    a = a[:a_length]<n>else:<n>    a_length, a_digit = 2, int(a)<n>a = a_digit<n>if b == 'has':<n>    b_length = len(b)//2<n>    b_digit = int(b[b_length:])<n>    b = b[:b_length]<n>else :<n>    b_length, b_digit = 2, int(b)<n>b = b_digit<n># convert int to string<n>if c == 'than':<n>    c_length_1, c_digit_1 = 2<n>c = c_digit_1<n>else :<n>    c_length, c_digit = 2<n>c_digit = c_length - 1<n>c = c_length,c_digit<n>print(c,a)<n>card_A = cards(int(card_a))<n>card_B = cards(int(c))<n># print answer (144)<n>print(card_B + card_A,  end = '', sep = '+')<n>if d == 'Jan
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:No matter the background of the person, they should all be given what in applying for the job? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:What preposition do you use if you want to combine two words? Choices:  A: article B: adjective C: interjection D: conjunction E: pronoun<n>Output:		A<n><n>#### Instructions:<n><n>##### Part I<n><n>You will need to know how many squares there are in a 9 x 9 grid. Here is an example, but there are no squares to see.<n><n>##### Part II<n><n>You will need a 9 x 8 array, but you must be able to fill it in by looking at what numbers precede the array.<n><n>## Difference Between Array and Matrix<n><n>#### Arrays<n><n>Arrays are multi-dimensional:<n>- They have N dimensions.<n>- They are two-dimensional for two-dimensional matrices.<n>- They use 0-indexing. The first element in an array is position 0.<n><n>#### Matrices<n><n>Matrices are two-dimenional as well, but they are one row, and one column, but they are different because they use 1-indexing. So, the first element in a matrix is row number 1. Column number 1 will be position 0.<n>

(e.g. if the input is 40 then it means that Brenda and Janice together have 90, since 40 +40 =90)<n>- But the value it returns is the sum of input + 10.<n>- That's because each time the method is called the number of cards is incremented by 1 to store it. So, we have to add 10 each time before summing the value of input to output a reasonable value.<n>- Also the logic behind storing the value to the cards variable was to ensure that the program does not return the value of the cards variable even if the user prints the value.<n><n>```java<n>class Solution {<n>    public static void

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. Choices:  A: ordering dog food online B: avoid eye contact C: feel guilty D: fall asleep E: blush<n>Output:		B<n>```<n><n>```python<n>def solve_question(q):<n>    # Read in question text, and split on commas<n>    q_text = q.strip().split(",")<n>    # Read in answer choices<n>    ans_choices = quesns_choices.strip().split(", ")<n>    ans_list = ans_choices.split(" ")<n>    q_text[len(range(len(q_text)-1))-1] = "None"<n>    # Make final question a tuple<n>    ques_tuple = (q_text, ans_list)<n>    # Pass questions and choices to the helper function<n>    ans_tuple = solve_question(ques_tuple, "answers")<n>    # If user gets a certain number of questions right, the function prints and returns "Correct"<n>    if( 6 >= 2 + ans_tuple['answers'] ) :<n>        print("Correct! \n")<n>        print(ans_tuple['question_text'],"\n")<n>        print("Answers: ",ans_tuple['answers'])<n>        return<n>    # Otherwise, user gets "Wrong..."<n>    print("Incorrect! \n")<n>    (question_text, answers) = ans_tuple<n>    print(question_text, "\n")<n>    print("Answers you chose: ", answers)<n>    return<n><n>qus_choices = """<n> Janet has 9 more cards than Brenda. Marion has twice as many cards than Brenda. How many cards do Mara have in all if Marion has 60 cards less than 200?<n><n>5<n>input<n><n>    Pete walked away from his house to the post office to collect stamps. He walked away again. He traveled the same. How many stamps do you have?<n><n>20<n>39<n><n>5<n>12<n><n>15<n>input<n><n>10<n>5<n><n>13<n>24<n> input<n><n><n>Q = quesns_tuple(qus_choices)<n>ans_tuple = solve_quest(Q, 'answers')<n>print(ans_tuple)<n><n><n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. The ratio of the amounts that Amanda and Jennifer contributed is 2:3. Sandra contributed 3/4 as much as Jennifer. How much did Sandra contribute?"<n>Output: 875<n>e.g.: 1,280 – 750 = 530 and because the ratio is 2:3, 2 × 530 = 1060. and 3 × 530/1060 = 550<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:Eating breakfast with a large family leads to a pile of what in the sink? Choices:  A: fullness B: underwear C: bad breath D: better day E: dirty dishes<n>Output:		Eating breakfast with a large famly leads to a pile dirty dishes.<n><n>### Coding:<n><n>    def count_cards(num1, num2, num3, num4, num5, sum)<n>        (num1-num4)*(num2-num5)*(num3-num2) * num4 = sum<n>    end<n><n>    def count(num1, num3, num2, sum)<n>        return (num1-num2)**2<n>    def count(x, y, z)<n>        return (x+y*z)**2<n>    end<n><n>### Tests<n><n>Counting the cards in a hand is not always easy for poker games. The game of poker has several different variants, which all work on the principle of counting the cards. If you count more cards in the hand, you can be a little clever and win more often.<n><n>### Program Solution:<n>#include<stdio.h><n>#include<math.h><n>int main()<n>{<n>int sum, x, y, z;<n>int num1, num2, sum2, num3, sum3;<n>int num4, num5;<n>int count=0;<n>scanf("%d", &num1);<n>scanf("%d%d%d", &x,&y,&z);<n>scanf("%i", &num2);<n>scanf("%f", &num3);<n>scanf("%F", &num4);<n>scanf("%D", &num5);<n>//-----------------------------<n>count=count(*pow(x,2)*pow(y,2)*pow(z,2)*(pow(x,2)-pow(y,2))*pow(x,2)/pow(z,2));<n>cout<<sqrt(sum*((pow(pow(x, y, y)+pow(x, y-1)*pow(*x, y-1)+pow(x, 2)*(*pow(x, y)-pow(x, y)*pow(x, 1))))-(*pow(z,3)));<n>sum+*pow(sqrt(sum*((*pow(t-z,3)+pow(*(pow(x,y),x)*(pow(x-z,z))+pow(t,y))-pow

The seal moves out 63 miles. How many miles is "a" away from the seal? Choices:  a: 10 miles b: 12 miles b: 28 miles c: 75 miles e: 100 miles<n>Output: 12 miles<n><n>Input: What is the length of the longest possible line that passes through the origin of a coordinate plane (on the xy-axis), but which does *NOT* intersect the origin on a diagonal?  Choices: a: 5 units<n>                                      b: 6 units<n>                                      c: 8 units<n>                                      d: 11 units<n>                                      e: 13 units<n><n>Output: 6 units<n>```<n><n>The answer for question (C) is 211. 211 (nine is 10 more than eight, ninety-nine is one hundred more than nine)<n><n>The answer for (E) is 18 and 6. 18 is 5 times larger than 4 (four is five times larger than 6). 6 is smaller than 2 (.5 more than 3), so 6 is five times larger than itself.<n><n>Answer for question (C)<n>```<n><n>```<n><n>```python <n><n>def run(arr):<n>    answer = 0<n>    count =0<n>    sum_arr = 0<n>    print_sum = 0<n>    for i in range(len(arr)):<n>        if arr[i] < 10:<n>            count = count-1<n>        else:<n>            count = 0<n>        sum_arr = sum_arr+arr[i]<n>        if arr[count] >= (10*20**(1)):<n>            print_sum = print_sum+sum_arr<n>        sum_arr=sum_arr+arr[count]<n>        if(i+1 < len(arr) and (arr[i]-=10) ==arr[i+1]):<n>            count = count+1<n>        arr.pop(0)<n>    return sum_arr/len(arr), sum_arr/len_arr

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. Choices:  A: problems B: offspring C: overpopulation D: larger family E: baby<n>Output:		A<n><n>Input: The number of days in winter increased by 63 during a certain two-year period in the 20th century, but its average daily-high temperature did not change. The number of days in the summer decreased by 24 during the same two years  without affecting its average daily-high summer temperature. Winter days increased by 16 fewer days than average during this period. And, the average daily-high summer temperatures increased. The number of days between the winter-time average high temperatures and the summer-time average high temperates increased by 1/3 the number of days between the summer-time average and winter-time average. How many days are there between winter temperatures and summer temperatures during this period, if the day temperature increase is the same everyday?<n>Output: 35<n><n>Input: A plane was flying from Phoenix to Las Vegas. In 15 minutes, it flew over California. If the plane flew 500 miles per hour and was flying 600 miles in one hour, how many miles did it travel before flying over California?<n>Output: 8<n><n>Input: A woman who was sick for 7 days was 50% better on the 7th day than she was on the 1st day. How long did the woman remain sick?<n>Output: 4.9<n><n>Input:A large tree stands at the base of a mountain.The tree is 20 feet tall and the shadow of the tree on the ground is 18 feet long. If the shadow of the tree changes position by 18.2 degrees a day, in which direction does the shadow move? Choices:  North A: East B: West C: Up D: Down<n>Output: B<n><n>Input: A bus travels 1/8 as fast as the speed limit. A hitchhiker walks in the direction that the bus is traveling. The bus stops to let a pedestrian cross the street. By how much does the bus lengthen its own trip? Choices: A: 1/8 B: 1/64 C: 1/48 D: 1/80 E: 2<n>Output: D<n><n>Input: A student earned an A in her chemistry class. She earned a percentage of A's. She received a grade of C in her bi

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:You can buy a pen here. Choices:  A: briefcase B: pocket C: friend's house D: office supply store E: classroom<n>Output:		F: office supply store<n>Input: A: briefcase B : pocket C: friend' s house D: office supply stare E: classroom<n><n>Input: You can buy a pen here Choices: __A__: briefcase__ B__: pocket__ C__: friend" s home__ D__: office supply store __E__: classroom Output: __F__: office supply store<n><n>Input: You have many books in your library Choices:_A__: history__ B__: mystery__ C__: biography__ D__: thriller__ E__: romance Output: _History<n><n>Input: What is your favorite kind of music__ Classical rock__ pop__ Jazz__ Hip-Hop__ Rap Output:__ Rap<n><n>Input: What kind of computer do you have__ Mac__ Windows__ DOS__ Linux__ Unknown__ Iphone __ Android __ Blackberry__ Ipad Output:__ Mac<n>------- -----<n>1. Answer is (D) if there is a choice between two numbers, take the larger one 2. Answer is (E) the choice is between two numbers choose the smaller one 3. Answer is (D). If two numbers are equal the choices given are (E, I and O).  if there is choice between two numbers take the larger one 4. Answer is (A). The options given are in upper case so (f) is the answer 5. Answer is (D), the choices given are in lower case(i) is the answer 6. Answer is (F), take the greater of the two values 7. Answer is (H), the choices given are all lower case(A) is the answer 8. Answer is (I) the options given are in upper and lower case (A, B, C) are the values 9. Answer is (I), the options are in upper and lower cases (Q and S), thus (Q) is the answer 10. Answer is (E). All the letters but (O) are capital, thus (F) is the answer <n><n><n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:James was delayed for a couple of hours because he had a connection.  Where might his connection be? Choices:  A: company B: airport C: wall D: computer network E: love<n>Output:		A<n><n>Input:The numbers 1, 12, 341 and 127209911, are divisible by __. Choices: A: 2 B: 3 C: 6 D: 7 E: 9<n>Output: D<n><n>Input: A number is chosen at random from the positive integers. What is the probability that the number is even?<n>Output: D<n>### Instruction:<n><n><n>### Solution：<n><n>  #define MAX 100001<n>  typedef long long ll;<n>  ll sum(ll n) {<n>        ll ans=0;<n>        for (ll i=1; i<=n; i++) {<n>                ans+=(ll)i*(ll)i;<n>        }  <n>        return ans;<n>  }<n><n>  int main() {<n>    int n,t,p;<n>    while(scanf("%d",&n)==1) {<n>        ll total_ans=0;<n>        ll left=n;<n>        while(total_ans<sum(n)) {<n>            if (n>0 && p==0){<n>                left--;<n>                t=1;<n>                p=0;<n>            }<n>            else if (t==0) {<n>                p=t;<n>                t=n;<n>                n-=t;<n>            }<n><n>            ll x=1;<n>            int ans=1,ans2=0;<n>            while (x<t) {<n>                <n>                if (x<t) ans++;<n>                if (x==n && x<t) ans2++;<n>                x++;<n>            }<n>        }<n>        printf("%d",p);<n>        total_ans+=sum(n);<n>        left-=total_ans;<n>    }<n><n>      <n>     return 0;<n>}<n><n>### Author：xingchen<n><n>### Email:xingchen_1997@foxmail.com<n>  <n>### QQ：1916411523

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:What should you do if your pens aren't work? Choices:  A: ink in B: caps C: ink cartridges D: take notes E: scribble<n>Output:		A<n><n>Input: A student took a bus 25 miles and a flight 15 miles to another city and back to campus in one day. What is the distance in total?<n>Output: 40<n><n>Input:[ 492 6 116 8 200 5]  Choices: A: 1  B: 4  C: 3<n>Output: A<n>```<n> <n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/python3<n><n>input = input()<n><n>ans=0<n>def func(l,n,k):<n>    m = (l[n-1]+k)%10<n>    k+=m<n>    n+=1<n>    if n%2==0:<n>        k =1<n>        n =1<n>    for i in range(k,n):<n>        a=func(n,i+1,l[i])<n>    return a<n>def fun(arr,n,k,j):<n>    ans+=(j*(1/n/k+(n/k)))<n>    for i in arr:<n>        j=1<n>        j*=i<n>    return j<n>print(fun(str(split(input)), 4, 4, 500000))<n>print(1/1/1)<n>print(func(str(split(1/1/3)),3,1))<n>```<n><n>

How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. Choices:  A: downtown area B: urban area C: new york city D: shopping mall E: military base<n>Output:		"D"<n><n>Input: Which of the following is not a type of bird?<n>A. Cardinal B. Hummingbird C. Seagull D. Parrot<n>Output: "Seagoose"<n><n>Input: How does a cow eat?<n>A. With a fork and knife B. With its mouth C. By a special way D. By turning its head<n>Output: "By a special way"<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:Why might someone want to be buying beer? Choices:  A: get arrested B: problems C: sober D: intoxication E: pleasure<n>Output:		A, C, and E<n><n><n>input: A, B, C, D, E, F, G are planets in our galaxy. E orbits the Sun twice as fast as A, which orbits the Sun twice the rate of B and C, which orbits the sun twice as often as F, which orbits the same number of times as D, which orbits the star G.  Choose the planet that orbits the Sun at the slowest rate:<n> Output: F<n>```python<n>class Solution:<n>    def findLengthOfLCM(self, A, B, C):<n>        if(A % B == 0 and B % C == 0):<n>            return A*B/C<n>        elif (A % B == 1 or B % C == 1):<n>            return A/B<n>        elif A % B == 0:<n>            return B/A<n>        return None<n><n>    def lengthOfLCM(self):<n>        A[1] = self.findLengthOfLCM(A[0], 3, A[1])<n>        # B[0] = 1st item of a new Array A<n>        A[2] = (1 % A[1])<n><n>        return A[1]<n>```<n><n><n>https://codefellows.org/blog/2016/12/12/new-years-resolutions-for-the-python-bootcamp-student/<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. Which one was the younger boy? ___   A:  the one born on March21 B:  the one born before March 10 C:  the one born after March21 D:  the boy born 10 years after the boy born on March 31<n>Output: C<n><n>Input:Four times (pizza) the price of a pizza is 15. What is the original price of a pizza? ___<n>Output: 5<n><n>Input:I need to take the dog (dining) to the park today. If John and Bill take the dog to the park, they would like to go also. What time would John and Bill go?<n>Output: 05:15<n><n>Input:There are 5 red, 3 blue, 2 yellow and 7 green apples. How many apples are in all?<n>Output<n><n>Input: There are 60 students in 6 classes at school. The first class has 16 students. The second class has 12 students. The third class has 3 students. The fourth class has 6 students. The fifth class has 9 students. The sixth class has 33 students. How many students are in all?<n> Output: 164<n><n>Input: If two trains have the same speed then which one reaches the station first? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. If it takes less than 3 seconds to make a toast sandwich, the sandwhich is considered a success. 3. A typical toast sandwich takes 19 seconds to make and requires 26 seconds of toasting time. None of the above B. 1180 C. 75 D. 250 E. 150<n>Output: B<n># Solution<n># IMPORTANT: <n># We start by importing the libraries<n># Numpy and Mathmatics from the Python library:<n># pip3 install numpy<n># pip3 install matplotlib<n><n># Next line is import numpy<n>import numpy as np<n># Next line is to import matplotlib<n>import matplotlib.pyplot as plt<n><n># In a matrix, there is a column<n># row of data<n>matrix = np.array([<n>[1, 1, 1],<n>[2, 2, 2],<n>[3, 3, 3],<n>[4, 4, 4],<n>[5, 5, 5],<n>[6, 6, 6]]<n>)<n><n># Let's define what the x and y coordinates of the points are<n># 5 = x coordinate of the top left point<n>5 = 0<n># 5 = y coordinate of the top left <n># point<n>5 = 4<n><n># x coordinate of the third point<n>3 = 5<n># y coordinate of the third point <n># (y coordinate of the third point +1)<n>3 = 4 +1<n><n># x coordinate<n>1 = 0<n># y coordinate <n>1 = 1<n><n># x coinmordinate<n>3 = 0<n># Y coordinate<n>3 = 15<n><n># x coordinate=1<n># Y coordinate =10<n><n># x coordinate = 2 y coordinate = 4<n><n>total = x[0] +

How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:If I had a jar which was likely to spoil if left out, where would I want to put it? Choices:  A: kitchen cupboard B: pantry C: grocery store D: pantry E: refrigerator<n>Output:		E<n><n>### Question 1:<n>Input: Janet and Brenda each have some number of cards. Janet has 9 more than Brenda. Janet has twice as many cards more than Brenda's card combined. How many cards do Janet and Brenda have in all if Brenda has 40 cards?<n>#### Solution:<n>### Step 1:<n>Write the data as an algebraic expression:<n><n>    $x = 9 - x$<n><n>### Step 2:<n>Write $x$ is greater than $Brenda$ in an algebraic expression,<n><n>    $x > Brenda$<n><n>###Step 3:<n>Write $x = m$ + 2,<n><n>    $2(2m)$<n><n>###Step4:<n>Combine the steps<n><n>$\begin{align*}Brenda&=\left( \left( 2\ (2m)\right)+9\right)-\left(\left(2\ (2m)+9\right)\right)\\ &=\left(2\ (m+9)\right) - 1\\ &=\left((m+9)-m\right)\\ &=\left(3 \times (m+9)\middle)+1\\ &=\left(3 \left(m+9)\right)\middle. +\left(3\right)\end{align*}$<n>\end{code}<n><n>Comment: Can you explain what you mean by "Input" and "Output"?<n><n>Comment: Sure. Input is the question given by the person. And output is the final expression or answer to the question.<n><n>Comment: Please clarify what you mean by "the final expression and answer." It sounds like a question might have multiple expressions (maybe in code). So what would be the "final" expression?<n><n>Answer: I am able to do the first one, but the others are not in a form that I can figure out.<n><n>\begin{code}<n>Input: Janet (x) and Brenda each have 40 cards. Janet has nine more cards than Brenda, and Janet has twice as<n>many cards as Brenda. How many cards do you have in all if Brendas cards (b) are forty-four?<n>Output: 45<n>\end{code}.<n><n>First, we need to find the "b" cards as a expression. We find the expression for

I then went to the second row and I repeated the same process. I was done once I got the last row because I had already added everything together.<n><n>My input was:<n><n>Number of students: 12<n><n>Number of pencils: 11<n><n>Input Output<n><n>Number of students Number of pencils - Algorithm<n>12 11 - Algorithm<n>10 10 - Algorithm<n>8 6 - Algorithm<n>6 4 - Algorithm<n>108<n><n>Output<n>```<n>Who has the most pencil?<n>I have the most pencils out of all the students<n>```<n><n><n><n>Note: Please read this page for information on how our peer review works: http://teacher.pitt.edu/labs/lab_03_homework.html<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. E -> 4,6<n><n>Solution<n>input = int(random())<n>if input>0 and input<5:<n>    print("A")<n>elif input>1 and input<3:<n>    print("B")<n>elif input>0 and input<=2:<n>    print("C")<n>elif input>3 and input<6:<n>    print("D")<n>else:<n>    print("E")<n>

Input:Janet has 9 cards <n>> more than Brenda.<n>> <n>> Mara has twice as <n>> many cards as Janet<n>> <n>> Input: Output:<n>> <n>> How many cards do they <n>> have in all if Mar<n>> a has 40 cards lessthan 150? 211  Let n = the number of <n>> cards in the pile of cards Janet 9,Brenda 3 <n>>, Mora 7 Mara has 211 -150 = 61 cards  <br> <br><n>> 2. Input: Pete walked <n>> 5 blocks from his <n>> house to the bus <n>> garage in Houston <n>>. He rode the bus <n>> 20 blocks to <n>> the post office <n>>  to get some <n>> stamps. Later, <n>>  he came home the <n>>  same way. How <n>> many blocks did <n>> Pete travel **in all?** 50<n><br>	<n><br> 3. Input: In a classroom <n>> , there <n>> are blue chairs, <n>> green <n>> chairs, and <n>> white chairs. <n>> There are 10 <n>> blue chairs. The <n>> green chairs are <n>> 3 times as many <n>> as the blue chairs, <n>> and there are 1<n>> 3 fewer white <n>> chairs than the <n>> green and <n>> blue chai<n>> rs combined. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:Having a car in the city seemed to be more trouble than it was worth, the man still had to walk to and from the what after commuting? Choices:  A: driveway B: the event C: scrap heap D: parking garage E: repair shop<n>Output:		A<n><n>#### Explanation:<n>```<n>Example:<n>Step 1: 9+n=150<n>Step 2 :9+2(150-40) =150 -> 150-160, the result is -10<n>```<n>```<n>Step 1: Janet has 4 times as the cards as Brenda.<n>Step 2: Janet has 16 cards more than Brenda, the difference is 16-14=2.<n>```<n><n><n>### Solution:<n><n># Solution.<n>```python<n>inp1 = int(input())<n><n># 1 line = 1 block (this will be used to find the distance)<n><n># find the number of blocks and the distance between blocks<n><n>distance_between_block = 1<n><n>num_of_blocks = 0 <n><n>while distance_between_block <= 10:<n>    num_of_blocks+= distance_between_block<n>    distance_between_block+=1<n><n># distance = int(num_of_block)<n><n># find num of blocks with distance 1 block: 2 times num_of_block<n><n>dist_time = distance_between_block * num_of_block <n><n># 10 blocks = 10 * 1<n><n>if inp1 == distance_between_block:<n>    print ("2")<n><n>else:<n>    print (dist_time, "days")<n>```<n>### Solution<n>```python<n>a = int(input())  # get input<n>d = a  # divide<n>divisor = int(input()) # get number that "d" will be divided by<n><n>remainder = d// divisor  # division of divisor and d<n><n>if remainder == 0:<n>    print('true')<n>else:<n>    remaining = int(remainder * divisor)<n><n>print (remaining)<n>```<n><n>### Solution<n><n>```python<n>s1 = int(input());<n>s2 = int(input());  # "s1" is subtracted from "s2"<n>summation =s2 - s1  # to subtract two integers<n><n>if summation > 0:<n>    if summation == 0:<n>        print ('false

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:HOw do you carry potatos home? Choices:  A: grocery store B: grocery bag C: restaurants D: farmer's market E: bushel basket<n>Output:		C<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:Sarah opened his chest and found a second heart.  Her patient might not be what? Choices:  A: istanbul B: animal C: antique shop D: human being E: bedroom<n>Output:		human being<n><n>Input: How many days are there in a two week period?<n>Output: 8<n><n>## Solution<n><n>***<n>#### Part - I: Brute force algorithm<n>**O(n^2) time complexity**<n><n>*Find Min and Max values:<n>	*If we want min value than find maximum by considering max value and subtracting it from current number<n>	*If we go by the condition in this question then we can get<n>	*If we are considering a negative value like in last input then this will not solve the question and it doesn't work<n>```<n>def find_min(self, nums):<n>```<n>```<n>nums[-1] - nums[0]<n>```<n>```<n>return nums[-1] - sum(nums) # in case nums are negative<n>```<n><n>```<n>if self.nums[-2] < self.nums[-1]:<n>		nums.append(self.nums[-2]+1)<n>		self.min = 0<n>		self.max = sum(nums)<n><n>elif self.nums[-3] < self.numS[-2]:<n>					.......<n>```<n>**O(n) space complexity**<n><n>*Insert to a list from a function:<n>```<n> self.minValue=min(self.nums)<n> self.maxValue=max(self.nums)+1<n> while self.sum<self.maxValue:<n>		if self.nums[self.sum]<self.minValue:<n>			self.minValue=self.nums[self<n>		self.sum=index+1<n>		try:<n>			nums.remove(self.nums[nums.index(self.nums1[index]))]<n>		except Exception as e:<n>			#Do what ever<n>		nums[nums1[index]]=self.num[self.sum]<n>		self.nums.append(nums1[index])<n>		sum += nums[sum]<n>	else:<n>		self.count+=1<n>	self.num.append([self.nums[i],self.count,self.sum])<n>```<n><n>*Repeat for every element<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. As 13 is less than 10 then the difference in number of white chairs is greater than 3 so it is (13 - 3) i.e 10. Therefore, the total number of chairs added to the total number of blue and green chairs is 10.<n><b>Answer2</b>- As 19 is less than 20 times the number of books in Beatrix's bookstore it means that each of their books will be 1/5th of any book in Alannah's library. So 30 books means that the total number of books in Alannah' busines will be 9. So 9 books will be there in Beatrix's library and there will be 14 books there in Alannah' bookstore which will be more than Bea's.<n>  <n>   <n>### Instruction: Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>Input: 20001/3. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:He found the blowfish off the coast of the Carolina's, it was where? Choices:  A: rock band B: sea of japan C: sushi restaurant D: fish market E: atlantic ocean<n>Output:		E<n><n>Input: I have 25 apples and 17 oranges. I also have 20 peaches and 8 pears. How many fruits do I have altogether?<n>Output: 70<n><n>Input: There are 6 red, 22 blue and 15 green candies. There are as many red candies as blue candies and as many blue candies as green candies.<n>How many candies are there in all?<n>Output : 71<n><n>Input: In an apartment building, there are 242 doors on each floor. On each floor, there are 6 apartments with 3 bedrooms, 12 apartments with 2 bedrooms, 16 apartments with a single bedroom and 5 with no beds.<n>On which floor has the most bedrooms?<n>Output: 4th floor <n><n>#### Coding Solution:<n>This is an example using python to find the answer of the questions.<n>Here, I am using for loop in order to make sure that we have the same total in the beginning and the end of the counting process.<n><n># Import required modules<n>import numpy as np<n>import matplotlib.pyplot as plt <n><n># Function to initialize value of n and m<n>def InitializeValueOfNAndM(m, n):  <n>    # Code in init variable to store the count<n>    num = 0<n>    for x in range(m):<n>        num = num + 1 <n>    return (0, num) <n><n># Funciton to add<n>def addNum():<n>    while True:<n>        n = int( input("How Many Doors: "))<n>        if n<= 1:<n>            print("Number of Doors Must Be More Then 1")<n>        else:<n>            m = int(input("How Many Beds: "))<n>            (start, stop) = InitializeValueOfNAndm(m,n)<n>            start = start + 1<n>            (n2, m2) = (InitializeValueOfNAndM (m, start))<n>            # print(start, m2)<n>            for i in range(start, stop):<n>                print(i, m2[0] + m2[1])<n>            if(i<=stop):<n>                print("Enter 1

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. Choices:  A: scotland B: europe C: race track D: new jersey E: england<n>Output:		B<n><n><n>### Solution<n>- 9 cards more than brenda = 9 > 5<n>- twice as many as janet <n>- twice as many  = 9 > 4,9<n>- how many cards do they have 9*(150-40) cards<n>105 cards<n><n>- 5 blocks from his hose to the post office to  get some stamps. In home > to post office =  to post office - home > home<n>5 blocks away<n><n>- there are green chairs 3 times more than blue chairs and 13 fewer white chair = 3*10 + (13-10) - 10* ((3*10+13)/2)<n>- therefore (after solving the quadratic equation 13 = 4/3*2*x = 13 => x = 16) we find that we have 16 whites more than greens <n>and 3 times more than blues.<n><n>16 times 10 (we chose the bigger one, 16 * 10 = 160) more than blues. that means we have 160 green chairs more than greens. And we  have 160*9 more than the blue chairs(9 was blue).<n>- 30 books = 20 more than Beatrix = 30 = Beatix*1.5 which means <n>- queen has 1.5 times more books than beatrix so Beatrix*2 => 4<n><n>and 4*1.5 = 6 there is 6 books in total<n><n>- I don't get the 140 berries. Why can i eat more than 10 berries. I don't get what "Samuel has 5 birds. " means either: how many berries do Samuel eat each day<n><n>- motorway = highway<n>Scotedland -> A<n>Europe -> B<n>Race track -> C<n>New jersey -> D<n>England -> E<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:The teachers needed to get their classrooms ready for the school year.  What is one thing they might do? Choices:  A: talk too much B: teach children C: open boxes D: answering questions E: giving homework<n>Output:		C<n><n>Input: Which would come after the following two numbers: 535; 163?<n>Output: 897<n><n>Input: Annie ate some fries, and 7/9 of a pizza. She saved more than 5/8 of her fries, and half of her pizza. What fraction of her total food did she save?<n>Output: 7<n><n>#### Answer:<n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>#### Question #2:<n><n>#### Solution #2:<n><n>## Part B: Code Challenge<n>[code challenge](https://leetcode.com/coding-challenges/efficent-fruit-seller/)<n><n>| Fruit | Price |<n>|---|---|<n>|1|2|<n>|2|4|<n>|3|6|<n>|4|8|<n><n>## Solution A<n>```<n>def profit(num:int,price:int) -> list(int):<n>    if price <= 1:<n>        price = 1<n>    if num > 0 and price > 0:<n>        return [price * 2 if 2*num+1 == price else ((2*num+1-price) / 2) for 2*num in range(max(0,price-2))]<n><n>def max_profit(num:int) -> list[int]:<n>    price = 1<n><n>    lis = []<n><n>    for i in list(range(num)):<n>        for j in profit(i= num, price= price):<n>            lis.append(j)<n><n>    for i, j in itertools.combinations(range(min(max(1,price),num)),2):<n>        if i == 0:<n>            continue<n><n>        if lis[i]-lis[j] == price:<n>            if a<num:<n>                return lis<n>            else:<n>                price=lis[0]<n>                p = a+(num-1)<n>                profit(num=p, price=price ) for i in range(p):<n>                    lis.append(profit(num=p,price=price)<n>                break<n><n>    return lis<n>```

Choices:  A: curiosity B: excitement C: boredom D: wonder E: fear<n>Output:		C<n><n><n><n>This is the file in CAT2021<n><n>### Important Note<n><n>Your solutions should work correctly even when the input data is in any of the above formats.<n><n>The `Problems.java` file contains a main function that will run your solution(s) and print the output for the given input to the console.<n><n>### Part I<n><n>We'll give you some practice working with multiple choice problems. Create two methods: one that takes in an integer _number_ and another which takes in a _String_ and returns an int. Write your methods using the guidelines in the 'Multiple Choice Question' instructions section.<n><n>### Import Step 3<n><n>Your file should include the following methods:<n><n>* a `Problems` class that implements `BannerSupplier` and a `Solutions` class that implements `ProblemSolver`<n><n>Now create a `Problems`-sourced `Banner` using Java 8, as in [Step 2](#import-step-2).<n><n>Finally, write your first method `number()` that is given an integer and return an int. Write your second method `string()` that is given a string and returns an int. See the `Problems` class reference for sample usage of these methods.<n><n>### Step 4 <n><n>Call your methods with data you generate from sample multiple choice problems from this file, and observe the result. This could look something like this:<n><n>    150<n>    50<n>    3 1 4 5 6<n>    211<n>    30<n>    7 8 11 14 14<n>    boredom<n><n>In the next step, make it possible to print out banner text instead of calling a data generator.<n><n>### Instruction:Make it possible to print banner text instead of the data generator.<n><n>**Sample Solution:**<n><n>```java<n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n>        Problems p = new Problems();<n>    <n>        System.out.println(p.getBanner());<n>    <n>        int number = 150;<n>        System.out<n>           .println(p.number(number));<n>    }<n>```<n><n>[Return to Previous Screen](../README.md#previous)

When recursively applying the fact orial function to 3, 2 will be the product of all its factors, i.e. 2 * 1.<n><n><n># About the Author<n>Nihitha Raman R is a self taught full stack developer.<n><n><n><n>

Mara has twiceas many cards as Janet, and 20 fewer cards than Brenda. How many cards do the girls have in all?<n>3) Input: In a classroom there are blue chairs and green chairs. The green seats face North, East, or South. The blue seats face East, South, or West. There are 12 blue seats and 16 green seats. Some of the green seats face East. 15 other seats are in the green seats, too. If there are blue seats on the East side, how many blue seats are there?<n>Output: 8<n><n>Steps: <n>1) Blue seats are 12, Green seats are 16.<n>2) One blue seat in east side.<n>3) Next, 2 green seats that face with east are 15.<n>4) Thus, one blue seat in east side and 2 green seats.<n>5) So there are 16 + 2 = 18 green seats.<n>6) No blue seats on the south side.<n>7) One green seat that face South is 15
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:Where might someone find old clothing? Choices:  A: trunk B: drawer C: suitcase D: book shelf E: washing machine<n>Output:		suitcase<n><n>```<n>#!/usr/bin/python<n>num=int(input())<n>count=0<n>while(num>=0):<n>    num='{:0}'+str(num)<n>    count+=1<n>    print("{:0}".format(num), end='')<n>print('+', end='')<n><n>count=0<n>if num=='000000':<n>    print('You have come to the end of road. I hope you had a good journey.')<n>else:<n>    print('The total distance you have traveled is:', count, 'feet. You haven\'t traveled 0 feet yet. You might even want to walk a bit more.')<n>```<n><n>- Instruction:Enter 5 numbers, separated by a space.<n><n>Input:20 30 10 25 40<n><n>Output: 465<n><n>- Instruction:(a)Enter the length of the rectangle.<n><n>(b)Enter the width.<n><n>Input:(Length, 10)Width, 5<n><n>Output: Area 50<n><n>```<n>print("Enter the length of the box:")<n>x=raw_input()<n>print("Enter the width of the box:")  <n>y=raw_input() <n>area=x*y<n>print("the area of the box is:", area)<n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:What is KFC who serves chicken? Choices:  A: fast food restaurant B: plate C: bowl D: freezer E: oven<n>Output:		A<n><n>Input:Which food in your house would probably be cheaper at a supermarket? Choices:  Pizza Eggs Cakes Bread Chips<n>Output: Cake Cakes<n><n>Input: What kind of bread have only 20% gluten? Choices:  white black brown wholemeal multigrain muesli<n>Output: black black black<n><n>Input: Which of these cheeses is usually used in pizza? Choices:  Provolone feta mozzarella cheddar Gouda cheese Parmesan cheese<n>Output: mozzarella<n><n>Input: A new car costs more than a used one but you can buy a used one for twice as much as a new one. Which statement is true? Choices:  The price of the used car could never be more than twice the price of the new car. The price of used cars could never be less than the price of new cars. You can save money by purchasing a used car. The price of a used car cannot be less than half the price of the new one. All prices include tax.<n>Output: You can save money by buying a used car.<n><n>Input: 15% of dogs have black coats. Of these, 25% drool, and no dog that drools has blue eyes. Of these dogs, 35% eat poop. Of non-eating dogs 65% do not drool. Which of these must be true? Choices: None of these statements could be true. All of these statements could be false. Some of these statements could be both true and false. At least some of these statements could be neither true nor false.<n>Output: None of these statements are true.  A little while later, they decided to start eating poop instead. But they all continued to drool, and as the poop was always frozen, all the dogs had blue eyes.  They had 35% more poop to eat, as a result.  The extra poop was stored in the freezer - and they all continued to droo<n>

At 9:00, the weather had turned cold; at 12:00, the mercury had dropped 5 degrees. At 15:00, the sun began to set, yet it wasn't dark out until 18:00, when the sun set. What is the highest temperature at 18:02? Remember, this is in degrees Celsius.<n>Output: 4; In Celcius the temp. changes every 3 hours, so it is +4 at 6:00; +9 at 9:00; +14 at 12:20 and +19 at 15:02; at 18:22 its +4 again because for Celcius it increases<n>by 4 if its not at the highest temp. The highest temp. at 18:32 = +9<n><n>Input: The numbers 2, 3, 5, 10, 17, 24, 36, and 55 each end in a 5. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:What should the bean bag chair sit on? Choices:  A: house B: den C: family room D: wood E: floor<n>Output:		Wood<n># 1<n><n>'''Solution:<n>Given data set1 Janet has 9 more cards than Brenda.<n>Mara has three times as many cards as Jan.<n>So total cards = Total number of cards held by Janet + Total number of cards held Brenda + 3*Mara.<n><n>Thus given:  Jan had 9 cards more than brenda and Mara has 2x as many cards as Jan,<n>We need to find how many cards in total? <n><n>We see the total no. of cards is 2xMar + br.so we can simply subtract 2xMar from brenda and add 2xMar - br.<n><n>So our answer would be 2xMar + 2xMar (2xMar) = 4xMar = 4. So 4xMar = (12 cards)<n>And 2xMar -brenda =brenda - 2xMar +5 (to add 9 to brenda) = brenda - 2x -9 = brenda - 18<n>Solution brenda -2x -18 = 150 - 2x -18<n>and 150 -2x -150 + 9 = 2 +9 = 11 <n>'''<n># 2<n><n>'''Solution:-<n>Pete walked 5 blocks to busway then he goes to post office 20 blocks from busway.so now he was 25 blocks way from home.<n>and then he again walks 5 blocks from post office to home.<n>so pete walked 5 +20 +5 =20 blocks from home <n><n>output : 20'''<n><n># 3<n><n>'''Solution -<n>Blue chairs green chairs &amp; white chairs are also defined like A: blue chairs B: green chairs C: white chairs<n><n>total no. of chairs = A + B + C (4.5)<n>And total chairs A+B = 10<n>B+C (13)<n>total chairs =13 (13 +10) = 23<n><n>Now as 4.5= (10A+A(10B+3A))<n>So we need A+(3A) = 4.5 <n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:The museum made an odd choice for the koala display, they put the stuffed creature in what area where you'd usually find a panda? Choices:  A: jungle B: bamboo grove C: australian outback D: china E: child's book<n>Output:		B<n><n>Input:What is the value of the following division? 34 / 11<n>Output: 3

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:What is someone likely to feel after receiving a gift that is not common? Choices:  A: special B: personal C: offended D: unique E: rare<n>Output:		B<n>

What was B's share of the 9 cents?<n>Output: B has 41/3 cents left<n>``` <n><n>#### Question 1:<n>- 100 is larger than 50, but how can they be divided equally?<n>```python<n>def is-bigger-or-divisible(a, b):<n>    return (a > b or math.ceil(a/b) >= a)<n># 100 is bigger<n>```<n><n>#### Question 2:<n>- Given: a=50, b=30. We have 2/5 of 50, which is <n>```python<n>def get-percentage(a):<n>    return int(a * 100)<n># 80% of 50 is 40 units<n>```<n><n>####Question 3:<n>- We will make the function `get-amount(x)` first, which tells us the amount given in x <n>```python<n>import math <n>

You received 5000 dollars from the visitors. The amount of money you received from the most rich visitor is 3 more than the sum of the money received from the least rich visitor. Choices:  A  B  C  D  E  F<n>Output: F, there are $500 - $5000 = $300 - $4800, making A more likely.<n><n>Input:Seth, Shawn, and Tony all have cash. Tony has 2.5x as much money as Seth. Choices: A  B  C<n>Output: B, Tony<n><n>Input: A small warehouse contains 1 large warehouse can hold 7 small warehouses and 9 large warehouses. How many warehouses does the small warehouse hold? Choices: A b  C  D  e<n>Output: E. If 7 small can fit in 1 large and 9 large can fit in 1 small, then 9 * 7 = 63 and 1 * 9 = 9<n><n>Input: 6 women and 9 men were riding in the back of an open pickup. There were 175 cigarettes. Each individual man smoked a cigarette. After the first pack was used, each couple had a pack. At the end, there were 32 unopened packs remaining. How many women were riding in the pickup?<n>Output: 31, 110 cigarette packs - 9 men - (32 packs / 2 cigarette packs per male) = 74 men and women. Divide 74 by 6 and you get 12.33. However, there are 32 packs, not 31. Therefore 14 women must have also been on the truck. Solved in c++ by calculating the length of each
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Output: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Output: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Output: 140<n><n>Input:What kind of radio does someone use to reach base? Choices:  A: vessel B: box C: transistor D: submarine E: lamp<n>Output:		E<n><n>Input:In 1353, Jeanne DeClermont married Jacques DuFrense, and they had four sons. In 1402, the family of Jeanne, with her eldest son (Alienor) and her daughters (Isabeau and Margaret), were taken as prisoners into England after the Battle of Poitiers. The family fled to Southamptomshire. What is the name of the eldest daughter? A: Jeanne B: Alienor C: Isabeau D: Margaret E: Margaret<n>Output: A<n>```<n>**#Question:3.**<n><n>```python<n>class Human:<n>    def __init__(self, name, num):<n>        self.name = name<n>        self.num = num<n><n>    def show_name(self):<n>        print(self.name)<n><n>    def show(self):<n>        self.show_name()<n>        print(self)<n><n>### 1.  TestCase<n>input = 'Anne'<n>name = Human(input, 10)<n>name.show()<n><n>### Test1:<n><n>input = 'Andy'<n>name = Human('Andy', input)<n>name.show_name()  # 'Andy'<n><n>### Test2:<n><n>input = ['John', 'Andy' ]<n>name = Human([input], [input[0]])<n>name.show()   #  test case  output:John, Andy<n><n>### Inputs:1.<n><n>A = 'John'<n>B = 'Andy' <n><n>input_list = [ input_string]<n>new_input = Human( input_list, A+B)<n>print(new_input)<n><n>### Outputs:<n>test1_output = Human('Andy')<n># test1_output.show_name() -> test1_output: name = Andy<n><n>test2_output = Human(['John', 'Andy'] )<n># test2_output.show() -> test2_output:  John, Andy<n><n>test3_output = [input_string]<n>newname = Human( test3_output, A+B)  #  test3_output = ['John']<n># newname.show_name. -> newname: name = Testname<n><n>

How much of the mural was made during each of the 66 hours spent painting?<n>Output: 0.95<n><n>### Explanations<n>1. Answer #1;<n>###<n> Janet has 9 less cards. 150 - Janet's cards = 35  <n>   Brenda has 9 more cards. 151 - Brenda's cards = 56  <n>Brenda have cards that total 56 and Janet have cards that total 35<n>   211 is the total<n><n>###<n> 1. Answer #2;<n>###<n> 5 + Pete's house = 15  <n>20 blocks to the bus<n>- 5 + bus route  <n>15 - 20<n>- Buses are used in place of cars  <n> 52 blocks between house and bus route is the answer   <n><n><n>###<n>3.Answer #3;<n>###<n> (10 blue chairs) (2 times the blue chairs = 20) (13 more white chairs)<n>(1 blue chair) + (2 times the blue chair) + (13 more white chair)<n>67 is the answer<n><n><n>### <n>4.Answer #4;<n>###<n>   (30 + 5 =45)<n>###<n> 30 * 3 = 90 + 3 * 3 = 54<n><n><n>5.Answer #5;<n>###<n>If you want to make more money at work, you should have ______ to keep the job safe and earn more and give you more stability.<n>###<n>C - The house<n><n>6.<n>###<n>Answer #6;<n>###<n>Eggs are used.
